1.speaker: ft panda
1.japanese: サービス サービス

2.speaker: ft panda
2.japanese: サービス サービス サービス サービス
2.english: Service, service. Mr. Panda! Service, service. {\a6}Everyone! Let's go see Mr. Giraffe next.

4.speaker: ft panda
4.japanese: サービス サービス サービス サービス

5.speaker: ft panda
5.japanese: いやぁ いい汗かいたね
5.english: Wow, we worked up quite a sweat.

6.speaker: panda
6.japanese: ありがとう 常勤さん

7.speaker: panda
7.japanese: 常勤さんがいるおかげで 僕のかわいさが引き立っちゃうよ
7.english: My cuteness is much more noticeable when you're around, Mr. Full-Time. What's wrong?

8.speaker: ft panda
8.japanese: ああ 何でもないよ

10.speaker: panda
10.japanese: ねぇねぇ 常勤さん ２人で ゴロゴロしようよ
10.english: Hey, Mr. Full-Time, let's laze around together. I guess I don't have a choice.

11.speaker: panda
11.japanese: １人で ゴロゴロするのも楽しいけど
11.english: It's fun lazing around by myself,

12.speaker: panda
12.japanese: ２人で ゴロゴロすると もっと楽しいよね
12.english: but it's even more fun lazing around together, isn't it?

13.speaker: ft panda
13.japanese: そうだね じゃあ 次は

14.speaker: ft panda
14.english: Let's do my side job together.

16.speaker: panda
16.japanese: やだよ お客さんがいないときは プライベートで ゴロゴロするんだもん
16.english: No way. When there aren't any visitors,  I laze around in private.

17.speaker: ft panda
17.japanese: パンダ君 ２人でやったら 内職も楽しいよ
17.english: Doing a side job together is fun, too, Panda.

18.speaker: panda
18.japanese: 一緒にやると 作業みたいじゃない？
18.english: Isn't it more like a chore if we do it together?

19.speaker: ft panda
19.japanese: 一緒にやりたいんだ 今日は
19.english: I'd like to do this with you today.

20.speaker: panda
20.japanese: 僕は ここで見てるよ
20.english: I'll be right here watching. When you're doing a side job, it only counts when you actually do it.

21.speaker: handa
21.japanese: だから 内職はダメですよ
21.english: I told you, no doing side jobs.

22.speaker: ft panda
22.japanese: じゃあ どうやって ヒマをつぶせばいいんだい？
22.english: Then how am I supposed to relieve my boredom?

24.speaker: ft panda
24.japanese: ねぇ パンダ君 一緒にやろう
24.english: Come on, Panda, let's do this together.

26.speaker: ft panda
26.japanese: あれ？ 半田さん いいの？
26.english: Oh? Are you sure, Mr. Handa?

32.speaker: speaker
32.japanese: またのご来園を お待ちしております

33.speaker: ft panda
33.japanese: お疲れさま パンダ君
33.english: Thanks for all your hard work, Panda.

37.speaker: ft panda
37.japanese: いや 何でもない またね
37.english: No, it's nothing. See you later. See you later.

39.speaker: penguin
39.japanese: 笹子さん どうでもいい話していい？
39.english: Miss Sasako, could I talk to you about something that doesn't matter?

40.speaker: sasako
40.japanese: どうでもいい話はやっぱり どうでもいい感じで 聞いたほうがいいんでしょうか？
40.english: When someone is saying something that doesn't matter, should I act like it doesn't matter?

41.speaker: penguin
41.japanese: その確認は いらないんじゃないかな
41.english: I don't think you need to ask that.

42.speaker: polar bear
42.japanese: 笹子さん ペンギンさんの話は 基本 適当に聞けば大丈夫だよ
42.english: Miss Sasako, you don't really have to listen carefully when Mr. Penguin is talking in general.

43.speaker: penguin
43.japanese: ちょっと 気の合う仲間とどうでもいい話するのって 最高でしょ？
43.english: Hey, now! Isn't talking about things that don't matter with your good friends the best? Indeed. We'll listen to you talk about that don't matter.

44.speaker: penguin
44.japanese: そう言われてまで話す 話じゃないんだよな
44.english: This isn't something that needed to be discussed that badly. I'm tired.

45.speaker: panda
45.japanese: やっぱり バイト週１日にしてもらおうかな
45.english: I think I'm going to ask to change my shift to be once a week, after all. Would you ask Mr. Handa for me, Mr. Penguin?

46.speaker: penguin
46.japanese: 僕が頼む理由が 見つからないんだけど
46.english: I can't seem to think of a reason I'd ask.

47.speaker: penguin
47.japanese: シロクマ君 見つかった？
47.english: Can you think of one, Polar Bear? It's also the best to listen to impossible demands from your good friends, too.

48.speaker: penguin
48.japanese: それはまぁ 最高だけどね
48.english: Well, yeah, that is the best...

49.speaker: panda
49.english: Oh, all right. I'll have Mr. Full-Time Panda ask.

50.speaker: panda
50.japanese: 笹子さん いつものお願い
50.english: Could I get my usual, Miss Sasako?

52.speaker: panda
52.japanese: 常勤パンダさん 遅刻かな？
52.english: I wonder if Mr. Full-Time Panda is late today.

54.speaker: panda
54.japanese: ヒマだから手伝ってあげよう
54.english: I guess I'll help out since I'm bored.

55.speaker: Panda
55.english: Oh, Mr. Handa. Where's Mr. Full-Time? Is he late?

58.speaker: handa
58.japanese: 常勤パンダさん シンガポールに行ったんだよ
58.english: Mr. Full-Time Panda went to Singapore.

62.speaker: handa
62.japanese: いや 外国へ転勤になったんだよ

63.speaker: handa
63.japanese: もう この動物園には 戻ってこないんだ
63.english: He won't be coming back to this zoo.

65.speaker: handa
65.japanese: これ 常勤パンダさんから
65.english: This is from Mr. Full-Time Panda.

66.speaker: handa
66.japanese: 辞令は ちょっと前に 出てたんだけど
66.english: The transfer order came in a while back,

67.speaker: handa
67.japanese: 常勤パンダさんが パンダ君には言わないでくれって
67.english: but he asked us not to tell you.

68.speaker: panda
68.japanese: 常勤パンダさんがいないと 僕のかわいさが引き立たないよ
68.english: But without Mr. Full-Time Panda here, my cuteness won't be as noticeable.

69.speaker: kid
69.english: So cute! He's cute! Oh my! Amazing! Isn't that cute? How's Panda doing?

70.speaker: kirino
70.japanese: いつもと変わらない感じですけど
70.english: He seems the same as usual.

71.speaker: handa
71.japanese: そう ならいいけど…

72.speaker: panda
72.english: All right, see you again tomorrow. I wonder if Panda will be okay.

74.speaker: letter/ftpanda
74.japanese: 何も言わないで いなくなって ごめん
74.english: I'm sorry I left without saying anything.

75.speaker: letter/ftpanda
75.japanese: 私 急に転勤が決まってね
75.english: My transfer came out of nowhere,

76.speaker: letter/ftpanda
76.japanese: シンガポールの動物園で 働くことになったんだ
76.english: and I've been reassigned to a zoo in Singapore.

77.speaker: letter/ftpanda
77.japanese: 半田さんたちには パンダ君に言わないでって私がお願いしたんだ
77.english: I personally asked Mr. Handa and the others not to tell you. I was being selfish.

78.speaker: letter/ftpanda
78.japanese: だから 半田さんたちを 責めないでほしい
78.english: So, please, don't be angry at them.

79.speaker: letter/ftpanda
79.japanese: 最後の日まで いつもどおり ２人で楽しく過ごしたくてね
79.english: I wanted to spend our last days together having fun like we always did.

80.speaker: letter/ftpanda
80.japanese: パンダ君とは 動物園で 週２日しか会わなかったけど
80.english: I only saw you twice a week,

81.speaker: letter/ftpanda
81.japanese: キミがいてくれて ずいぶん楽しかったよ
81.english: but I had a lot of fun with you being there, Panda.

82.speaker: letter/ftpanda
82.japanese: それから シンガポールは 暑いだろうから コタツ置いてくね
82.english: Also, I'm sure it's hot in Singapore, so I'm going to leave the kotatsu.

83.speaker: letter/ftpanda
83.english: Feel free to use it. Also, I'll leave behind the supplies for my side job so you can do it if you get bored.

84.speaker: letter/ftpanda
84.japanese: もっと２人で お客さん 喜ばせたかったな
84.english: I wish we could have made even more visitors happy together.

85.speaker: letter/ftpanda
85.japanese: ありがとう パンダ君

86.speaker: letter/ftpanda
86.english: Thank you. Please take one. Please take one. Please take one.

88.speaker: ft panda
88.japanese: パンダ君 ２人でやったら 内職も楽しいよ
88.english: Panda... Doing a side job together is fun, too.

89.speaker: guy
89.japanese: あっ すみません いりませんでした？
89.english: Oh, I'm sorry. Did you not want one? Without Mr. Full-Time here, I... Huh? Mr. Full-Time... U-Um...

92.speaker: penguin
92.japanese: やあ ペンギンやってると 小銭入れる場所に困るね
92.english: Man, when you're a penguin, it's hard to find a place to put your change.

93.speaker: sasako
93.english: Mr. Penguin. What? What's wrong with Panda?

94.speaker: polar bear
94.japanese: そっとしておいてあげて
94.english: Let's leave him alone for a while. Huh? So, how's Panda doing?

95.speaker: sasako
95.japanese: 元気ないみたいですよ
95.english: I heard he's not doing too well.

96.speaker: polar bear
96.japanese: 常勤パンダさん 急だったからね
96.english: The whole thing with Mr. Full-Time Panda happened so suddenly.

97.speaker: handa
97.japanese: 今日 パンダ君に 相談できればって思ったのはね…
97.english: The thing I wanted to talk to you about today...

98.speaker: handa
98.japanese: ほら 常勤パンダさんが 転勤しちゃったでしょ
98.english: You know, Mr. Full-Time Panda transferred... Yeah...

99.speaker: kirino
99.japanese: で 今 うちの動物園 パンダ君しか パンダがいないでしょ
99.english: So right now at our zoo, you're our only panda, right? Yeah.

100.speaker: handa
100.japanese: パンダ君って ほら 週２日の バイトで来てるでしょ
100.english: And you only work twice a week, right?

101.speaker: kirino
101.japanese: そうすると うちの動物園  週２日しか パンダが見られないじゃない
101.english: So visitors are only able to see a panda twice a week at our zoo.

102.speaker: handa
102.japanese: だから できたらでいいんだけど 新しいパートのパンダさんが 見つかるまで
102.english: So, this is only if you can, but it'd help us out a lot if you could work like five days a week

103.speaker: handa
103.japanese: パンダ君に 週５日くらい 出てもらえると助かるんだ
103.english: until we find another part-time panda. Oh, three days a week is fine, as well. I guess Mr. Full-Time isn't here anymore, huh? Mr. Panda! I wonder what got into Panda?

104.speaker: handa
104.japanese: まさか 週７日も出勤するって 言うとは思わなかったな
104.english: I never thought he'd say he'd like to work seven days a week.

105.speaker: kirino
105.japanese: ホント助かりますよね
105.english: But that does help out a lot. But... we really need to find another part-timer soon.

109.speaker: penguin
109.japanese: 週７日って あの週７日？
109.english: By seven days a week... You do mean {\i1}that{\i0} seven days a week, right?

110.speaker: llama
110.japanese: みんな 驚いてます

111.speaker: penguin
111.japanese: 週２日のバイトを 週１日にしたがってたパンダ君が？
111.english: The same Panda who worked twice a week and wanted to only work once a week?

112.speaker: llama
112.japanese: 半田さんは 週３日でもいいって 言ったらしいんですけど
112.english: It seems Mr. Handa did say three days a week would work...

113.speaker: penguin
113.japanese: 週２日のバイトすら 午後出勤にしたがる あのパンダ君が？
113.english: The same Panda who wanted to show up in the afternoon on his two days a week?

114.speaker: sasako
114.japanese: 最近 うちにも あんまり来てないんですよ
114.english: He hasn't really been around here lately, either.

115.speaker: llama
115.english: He seems to be rather busy...

116.speaker: penguin
116.japanese: どうしたの？ パンダ君は

117.speaker: penguin
117.japanese: カレンダー わからなくなっちゃったのかな
117.english: I wonder if he doesn't understand the calendar anymore.

118.speaker: sasako
118.japanese: そういうことじゃ ないんじゃないですか
118.english: I don't think that's quite it.

119.speaker: llama
119.japanese: シロクマさん おかわりもらえますか
119.english: Could I get another, Mr. Polar Bear?

121.speaker: llama
121.japanese: おはようございます パンダ君

122.speaker: panda
122.japanese: おはよう ラマさん

123.speaker: kirino
123.japanese: 結構 続きますね パンダ君

124.speaker: handa
124.japanese: 今のところ休みなしだな
124.english: He hasn't had a day off so far. Cute! Super cute!

125.speaker: kirino
125.japanese: 先輩 ちょっとここ つねってみてくれます？
125.english: Mr. Handa, could you pinch me on the cheek?

126.speaker: crowd
126.japanese: え？ あのパンダ君が毎日 働いてるのが 信じられなくて

127.speaker: handa
127.japanese: え？ あのパンダ君が毎日 働いてるのが 信じられなくて
127.english: Huh? I can't seem to believe that Panda is actually working every day.

128.speaker: handa
128.japanese: さあ 俺たちも仕事 仕事
128.english: And we should get back to work, as well.

131.speaker: llama
131.japanese: ありがとうございます

132.speaker: sasako
132.japanese: パンダ君 頑張ってるらしいですね
132.english: I heard that Panda's working very hard.

133.speaker: llama
133.japanese: ええ 週７日は大変だと思いますよ
133.english: Indeed. Seven days a week must be rather hard.

134.speaker: llama
134.japanese: パンダの仕事は 動物園の中でも忙しいですから
134.english: Out of all the jobs at the zoo, his is one of the busiest.

135.speaker: sasako
135.japanese: そうですよね 大丈夫ですかね？ パンダ君
135.english: You're right. I wonder if Panda is doing all right.

137.speaker: penguin
137.japanese: ねぇ みんな心配するけど 毎日 働くのは普通だよね？
137.english: Hey, everyone's so worried, but it's normal to work every day, isn't it?

138.speaker: penguin
138.japanese: みんな パンダ君に 甘すぎるんじゃないかな？
138.english: I think all of you are spoiling Panda too much.

140.speaker: kirino
140.japanese: 疲れて寝ちゃってますね
140.english: He's so tired that he's asleep.

144.speaker: kirino
144.japanese: やっぱり雨でも バレンタインデーは お客さん多いっすね
144.english: There are still quite a few visitors on Valentine's Day, despite this rain. Especially couples. That's enough. Come on, back to work.

145.speaker: kirino
145.japanese: 先輩は誰かにチョコもら…
145.english: Did you get any chocola— I said work!

148.speaker: guy
148.japanese: わかった わかった

149.speaker: guy
149.japanese: なんか寝てばっかで動かねえな
149.english: He's like asleep and won't move.

150.speaker: guy
150.japanese: なんだよ あのパンダ
150.english: What the hell's up with that panda?

153.speaker: penguin
153.japanese: つまんないって 何？

155.speaker: penguin
155.japanese: 確かに パンダ君はね ふだん週２日しか働かない だらしないヤツだよ
155.english: It's true that Panda is usually a lazy guy who only works twice a week! Wh-What the hell?

157.speaker: penguin
157.japanese: 何かあると すぐにバイトを 代わってもらおうとするし
157.english: always tried to get his shift covered if the littlest thing happened!

158.speaker: penguin
158.japanese: ゴロゴロして仕事はサボるし 朝の満員電車が嫌いで
158.english: He'd laze around and not work, he hated the rush hour train in the morning,

159.speaker: penguin
159.japanese: いつも いつも サボることばっかり考えてて 働くのが大嫌いで
159.english: and he always, constantly, thought about how to skip out on work. He hates working,

160.speaker: penguin
160.japanese: カフェで だらだらするのが 大好きなヤツなんだよ
160.english: and he likes to just lay around the Café!

161.speaker: penguin
161.japanese: 本当に最高に ダメなヤツなんだよ

162.speaker: penguin
162.japanese: そのパンダ君が どれだけ 頑張ってるか知ってんのかよ
162.english: But do you even know how hard that Panda is working?!

163.speaker: penguin
163.japanese: 知ってんのかよ つまんないとか言うなよ
163.english: Do you?! Don't you dare say this sucks!

168.speaker: sasako
168.japanese: へえ パートのパンダさん決まったの？
168.english: I see. So they found a new part-time panda?

170.speaker: panda
170.japanese: やっぱり週２日だと 人生の充実感が違うよ
170.english: I totally feel alive again after going back to two days a week. Here you go, Panda. Have this.

172.speaker: polar bear
172.english: It's on the house. Oh, Mr. Penguin. Hey, Panda. You're here.

173.speaker: panda
173.japanese: 半田さんに聞いたんだけど

174.speaker: panda
174.japanese: この間 動物園で 怒ってたらしいね
174.english: That you were ranting at the zoo the other day.

180.speaker: penguin
180.japanese: そうなの？ ありがとう

181.speaker: panda
181.japanese: おいしいね ペンギンさん
181.english: It's delicious, isn't it, Mr. Penguin? Yeah. Hey, Mr. Penguin. What is it?

182.speaker: panda
182.japanese: 久しぶりに どうでもいい話を たくさん聞かせてよ
182.english: It's been a while, so tell me all sorts of things that don't matter.

183.speaker: penguin
183.japanese: 話したくなくなる言い方だけど うん 話そうか
183.english: I'd rather not when you put it that way... All right, I will.

185.speaker: penguin
185.japanese: えっと… スルーかい？
185.english: Um... you're just going to ignore me now?

186.speaker: panda
186.japanese: ペンギンさん これ見てよ

188.speaker: panda
188.japanese: ほら 絵ハガキが来たんだよ
188.english: Look! I got a postcard. From Mr. Full-Time Panda?

190.speaker: panda
190.japanese: シンガポールにも内職があるんだって
190.english: Apparently there are side jobs in Singapore, too! Wow.

191.speaker: polar bear
191.japanese: 元気そうだね 常勤パンダさん
191.english: Mr. Full-Time Panda seems to be doing well.

192.speaker: panda
192.japanese: これから ときどき 絵ハガキ 送るって
192.english: He said he'd keep sending postcards from time to time.

193.speaker: penguin
193.japanese: よかったね パンダ君

195.speaker: Panda
195.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん
195.english: Mr. Penguin, Mr. Penguin. What is it, Panda?

196.speaker: panda
196.japanese: 蟹を食べてる時に黙ってしまう人たちに厳しい一言を言ってあげてよ
196.english: Please scold the people who don't say a word while they are eating crab!

197.speaker: penguin
197.japanese: 厳しくする理由が分かんないだけど　蟹に逃げるな
197.english: I don't know why that'd call for a scolding, but don't use the crab as an excuse!

198.speaker: sasako
198.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

199.speaker: penguin
199.japanese: 完全に呼んだだけだったでしょ
199.english: You totally just wanted to say that, didn't you?

200.speaker: sasako
200.japanese: すみません　やってみたくて
200.english: I'm sorry, I just wanted to try it.

201.speaker: penguin
201.japanese: しろくまくん　終わろう

202.speaker: polar bear
202.japanese: 来週のしろくまカフェは

203.speaker: polar bear
203.japanese: いつもよりアルファー波大目でお送りします
203.english: will be brought to you with even more alpha waves than normal. We don't emit them to begin with.
